J. M. E. McTaggart, c1920?, (1943). Creator: Roger Fry

J. M. E. McTaggart, c1920?, (1943). Portrait of John McTaggart Ellis McTaggart (1866-1925), English idealist metaphysician, fellow and lecturer in philosophy at Trinity College, Cambridge. From " British Philosophers, by Kenneth Matthews. [Collins, London, 1943]

Heritage Images features heritage image collections

Media ID 19777800

Â© The Print Collector/Heritage Images

Britain In Pictures Collins Kenneth Kenneth Matthews Matthews Metaphysics Philosopher Philosophy Roger Social History William Collins William Collins And Sons William Collins Sons Mctaggart Metaphysician

Poster Print A2 (59.4 x 42cm)

"Introduce a thought-provoking addition to your space with our exclusive McTaggart Poster Print from Media Storehouse. This captivating portrait of J. M. E. McTaggart, taken by renowned artist Roger Fry around 1920, showcases the English idealist metaphysician in his academic prime. A fellow and lecturer at Trinity College, Cambridge, McTaggart's groundbreaking ideas continue to inspire philosophical discourse. Bring a piece of intellectual history into your home or office with this stunning and intriguing print."

A2 Poster (59.4 x 42cm, 23.4" x 16.5" inches) printed on 170gsm Satin Poster Paper. Securely packaged, rolled and inserted into a strong mailing tube and shipped tracked. Poster Prints are of comparable archival quality to our Photographic prints, they are simply printed on thinner Poster Paper. Whilst we only use Photographic Prints in our frames, you can frame Poster Prints if they are carefully supported to prevent sagging over time.

Poster prints are budget friendly enlarged prints in standard poster paper sizes (A0, A1, A2, A3 etc). Whilst poster paper is sometimes thinner and less durable than our other paper types, they are still ok for framing and should last many years. Our Archival Quality Photo Prints and Fine Art Paper Prints are printed on higher quality paper and the choice of which largely depends on your budget.

Estimated Image Size (if not cropped) is 42cm x 47.9cm (16.5" x 18.9")

Estimated Product Size is 42cm x 59.4cm (16.5" x 23.4")

These are individually made so all sizes are approximate

Artwork printed orientated as per the preview above, with portrait (vertical) orientation to match the source image.

EDITORS COMMENTS

This print showcases J. M. E. McTaggart, a prominent figure in English philosophy during the early 20th century. Created by the talented artist Roger Fry, this oil painting beautifully captures the essence of John McTaggart Ellis McTaggart, an esteemed metaphysician and lecturer at Trinity College, Cambridge. The portrait exudes a sense of intellectual depth and contemplation as McTaggart gazes into the distance with a thoughtful expression on his face. The vibrant colors used by Fry bring life to the image, highlighting both the subject's distinguished features and his connection to British history. As we delve into this piece of art, we are transported back to England in the 1920s or possibly even later in the 1940s when this print was created. It serves as a window into a different era - one where philosophical discourse thrived and great minds like McTaggart shaped our understanding of metaphysics. Preserved within these brushstrokes is not only an appreciation for British philosophers but also for social history itself. This print is part of Kenneth Matthews' book "British Philosophers" published by Collins in London in 1943, offering us insight into how intellectuals were celebrated during that time. With its rich historical context and artistic brilliance, this portrait reminds us of John McTaggart Ellis McTaggart's enduring legacy as a philosopher who left an indelible mark on British philosophy and beyond.
